info.title: Lawmatics OAuth API v1.21.0
info.description:
Welcome to the Official Lawmatics RESTful API Documentation.

Like the Lawmatics Platform, our API is under active development!  
For any API related questions or feedback, reach out to us at [api@lawmatics.com](https://mailto:api@lawmatics.com).

## CHANGELOG

#### 03/04/2023 - 1.21.0

- Add new endpoint: POST **Time Entry**.
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Time Entry**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Expenses**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Expense**
- Add new endpoint: POST **Expense**
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Expense**
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Expense**
    

---

#### 10/04/2023 - 1.20.0

- Add new endpoint: GET **Time Entry**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Time Entries**.
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Time Entry**.
    

---

#### 09/29/2023 - 1.19.0

- Add **Company** Finder endpoints, they behave the same as the **Contact** Finder endpoints, but return a **Company**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Find Company by Name**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Find Company by Email**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Find Company by Phone**.
- Update Filter Operator capabilities for presence checking: e.g. "null", "not_null"
    

---

#### 09/27/2023 - 1.18.0

- Add new endpoint: POST **Matter Sub Status**.
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Matter Sub Status**.
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Matter Sub Status**.
    

---

#### 09/21/2023 - 1.17.0

- Add new endpoint: GET **Custom Contact Type**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Custom Contact Types**.
- Add new endpoint: POST **Custom Contact Type.**
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Custom Contact Type.**
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Custom Contact Type.**
    

---

#### 7/07/2023 - 1.16.0

- Add new endpoint: GET **Email Campaign**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Email Campaigns**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Email Campaign Stats.**
    

---

#### 7/07/2023 - 1.15.0

- Add new endpoint: GET **Folder.**
- Add new endpoint: GET **Folders.**
- Add new endpoint: POST **Folder.**
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Folder.**
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Folder.**
- Update **Task** endpoints to create/read/update/delete **Task** `recurrence_rule`_**.**_
- Expose `assigned_by_id` on **Task** endpoints.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Task Status.**
- Add new endpoint: GET **Task Statuses.**
- Add new endpoint: POST **Task Status.**
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Task Status.**
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Task Status.**
- Add new endpoint: GET **Subtask.**
- Add new endpoint: GET **Subtasks.**
- Add new endpoint: POST **Subtask.**
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Subtask.**
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Subtask.**
- Add new endpoint: GET **Comment.**
- Add new endpoint: GET **Comments.**
- Add new endpoint: POST **Comment.**
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Comment.**
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Comment.**
    

---

#### 3/23/2023 - 1.14.1

- Update **Tag** endpoints to support attaching, detaching, and filtering by **Tasks.**
    

---

#### 11/11/2022 - 1.14.0

- Add new endpoint: POST **User**.
- Add new endpoint: PUT **User**.
- Add new endpoint: DELETE **User**.
    

---

#### 10/3/2022 - 1.13.1

- Expose creating **Company Matters** by name, passing company_name to POST **Matters**
- Expose creating **Company Matters** by passing Company ID to POST **Matters**
- Improve **Contact** deduplication (if matches on email or phone) on POST **Matters**
- NOTE - Any passed **Contact** Info (phone/email/address) for a **Company Matter** will be set on a found/created **Contact** as the **Company Matter's** P.o.C (primary_contact)
    

---

#### 9/19/2022 - 1.13.0

- Add new endpoint: GET **Company**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Companies**.
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Company**.
- Add new endpoint: POST **Company**.
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Company**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Interaction**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Interactions**.
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Interaction**.
- Add new endpoint: POST **Interaction**.
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Interaction**.
    

---

#### 8/8/2022 - 1.12.0

- Add new endpoint: GET **Relationship Types**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Relationship Type**.
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Relationship Type**.
- Add new endpoint: POST **Relationship Type**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Relationships**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Relationship**.
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Relationship**.
- Add new endpoint: POST **Relationship**.
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Relationship**.
    

---

#### 8/4/2022 - 1.11.0

- Add new endpoint: PUT **File**.
- Add new endpoint: DEL **File**.
    

---

#### 7/20/2022 - 1.10.0

- Add new endpoint: GET **Phone Numbers**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Phone Number**.
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Phone Number**.
- Add new endpoint: POST **Phone Number**.
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Phone Number**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Email Addresses**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Email Address**.
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Email Address**.
- Add new endpoint: POST **Email Address**.
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Email Address**.
    

---

#### 6/26/2022 - 1.9.0

- Add new endpoint: GET **Event Type**.
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Event Type**.
- Add new endpoint: POST **Event Type**.
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Event Type**.
    

- Improve validations, and error handling on many endpoints.
    

---

#### 6/25/2022 - 1.7.0

- Add new endpoint: PUT **Address**.
- Add new endpoint: POST **Address**.
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Address**.
    

- Add new endpoint: POST **Upload File**.
    

- Improve validations, and error handling on many endpoints.
    

---

#### 6/19/2022 - 1.6.0

- Add new endpoint: GET **Event**.
    

- Add new endpoint: GET **Custom Field**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Custom Fields**.
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Custom Field**.
- Add new endpoint: POST **Custom Field**.
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Custom Field**.
    

- Add new endpoint: GET **Practice Area**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Practice Areas**.
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Practice Area**.
- Add new endpoint: POST **Practice Area**.
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Practice Area**.
    

- Add new endpoint: GET **Note**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Note**.
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Note**.
- Add new endpoint: POST **Note**.
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Note**.
    

- Add new endpoint: GET **Address**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Addresses**.
    

- Add new endpoint: GET **File**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Files**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Download File**.
- Add ability to filter list GET endpoints by contact_id, matter_id, client_id, company_id on polymorphic relationships.
- Add type specific custom field value attribute keys to Matter payload (e.g. value_string, value_int, value_datetime).
- Update documentation.
    

---

#### 5/9/2022 - 1.5.1

- Add support for submitting `Originating Attorney`, `Lead Attorney`, `Salesperson`, `Assigned Staff` fields on PUT/POST Prospect endpoints.
    

---

#### 5/8/2022 - 1.5.0

- Add new endpoint: GET **Task**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Tasks**.
- Add new endpoint: PUT **Task**.
- Add new endpoint: POST **Task**.
- Add new endpoint: DEL **Task**.
    

---

#### 4/27/2022 - 1.4.6

- Add new endpoint: GET **Invoice**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Invoices**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Transaction**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Transactions**.
- Add new endpoint: POST **Transaction**.
    

---

#### 8/28/2019 - 1.4.5

- Add new endpoint: POST **Event**.
- Add new endpoint: DELETE **Event**
    

---

#### 6/21/2019 - 1.4.4

- Add new endpoint: GET **Locations**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Events**.
- Add new endpoint: GET **Event Types**.
    

---

#### 4/5/2019 - 1.4.3

- Fix bug with '.' included in email param for GET **Contact** find_by_email endpoint.
- Fix bug with '.' included in email param for GET **Matter** find_by_email endpoint.
    

---

#### 4/1/2019 - 1.4.2

This update allows you to get more information about firm **Pipelines** or a specific **Pipeline**.

- Add new endpoint: GET **Pipeline** by id
- Add new endpoint: GET **Pipelines**.
- Update documentation.
    

---

#### 3/31/2019 - 1.4.1

This update allows you to search for a **Contact** and adds an important field to **Stages**.

- Update GET **Stages** endpoint to return its **Pipeline** Relationship with `fields=pipeline`.
- Add **Contact** Finder endpoints, they behave the same as the **Matter** Finder endpoints, but return a **Contact**.
- Update documentation.
    

---

#### 3/27/2019 - 1.4.0

This update adds the ability to create a **Matter** for an existing **Contact**.

- Add `contact_id` option to the POST **Matter** (Create) endpoint.
- Add `match_contact_by` option to the POST **Matter** (Create) endpoint.
    

---

### CUSTOM FORM NOTE:

If you just are looking for info on submitting Custom Forms: You do not need to make a devleoper app. So disregard auth info below and use our UNAUTHENTICATED Custom Form Submit endpoint: [https://docs.lawmatics.com/?version=latest#c34ea101-b7af-46ac-a6c7-d185495af4f4](https://docs.lawmatics.com/?version=latest#c34ea101-b7af-46ac-a6c7-d185495af4f4)  
You will not need to create a developer app, and you do not need to go through the OAuth2.0 grant flow!

post.description:
Create a new **Address**

**Required Fields**: addressable, label, street

**addressable_type**: Prospect, Contact, Company, or Firm that the Address belongs to.

**addressable_id:** Id of Record. Firm type doesn't need an ID passed and it will be ignored.

Note - Setting the **Address** through a **Prospect** (Matter) will set the address on the Prospects' **Contact**/**Company**.

post.description:
Create a new Custom Field

Name: Custom Field's name

Type: One of `Matter`, `Contact`, `Company`, `Client`, or `PracticeArea`

Visibility (optional): `starred`, `hidden`, `default` (default)

field_type: One of `integer`, `boolean`, `string`, `text`, `currency`, `date`, `time`, `datetime`, `list`, `lookup`, `multi_picklist`

list_options: Required if field_type is `list` or `multi_picklist`, two options at minimum

lookup_type: Required if field_type is `lookup`. One of `User`, `Contact`, `Company` or `Prospect`

practice_area: Name of practice area. Required if type is `PracticeArea`

get.description: This *Unauthenticated* endpoint takes a __Custom Form__ id and returns metadata about that __Custom Form__. This metadata can be used to recreate a Lawmatics __Custom Form__ to be filled using your own html code.
A __paginated__ list of all Custom Forms in Lawmatics
A __paginated__ list of all Custom Form Entries in Lawmatics by Custom Form uuid

post.summary: Submit Custom Form Entry  (Form Data Body)
post.description:
This *Unauthenticated* (YOU DO NOT NEED A DEVELOPER APP) endpoint submits __Custom Form__ values. Keys for the values use the __Custom Form__ field ids found in Lawmatics, or found via the GET endpoint.

Data should be serialized via form-data (plain html5 forms) or JSON body (shown in next example)

Any automations will trigger as expected when this __Custom Form__ is submitted via the API.

custom_field_2263.description: An example param for a custom or non-standard field. (These are found under API details on the Form builder page).

first_name.description: An example param for a standard form field

last_name.description: An example param for a standard form field

utm_campaign.description: An example param for a Campaign tracking field, this value can be extracted from the cookie set by your LM tracking pixel

utm_source.description: An example param for a Source tracking field, this value can be extracted from the cookie set by your LM tracking pixel

201.description: POST Submit Custom Form (Form Data Body) / POST Submit Custom Form (JSON Body)

post.description:
Create a new **Email Address**

**Required Fields**: informationable, label, info

**info:** The **Email Address** string.

**label**: The **Email Address's** label e.g. Primary.

**informationable_type**: **Prospect**, **Contact**, **Company**, or **Firm** that the **Email Address** belongs to.

**informationable_id:** Id of Record. **Firm** type doesn't need an ID passed and it will be ignored.

Note - Setting the **Email Address** through a **Prospect** (Matter) will set it on on the **Prospects**' **Contact**/**Company**.

get.description:
Returns a specific campaign in **Lawmatics**.

To retrieve a specific campaign, use the following format: TypeofCampaign-id

An example of retrieving a marketing campaign would be:  
/v1/email_campaigns/MarketingCampaign-1

An example of retrieving a recurring campaign would be:  
/v1/email_campaigns/RecurringCampaign-1

An example of retrieving a date campaign would be:  
/v1/email_campaigns/DateCampaign-1
Returns all email campaigns in **Lawmatics**.

Retrieves a statistics of a specific email campaign in Lawmatics.

To retrieve a specific campaign, use the following format: TypeofCampaign-id

An example of retrieving statistics of a marketing campaign would be:  
/v1/email_campaign_stats/MarketingCampaign-1

An example of retrieving statistics of a date campaign would be:  
/v1/email_campaign_stats/DateCampaign-1
A __paginated__ list of all Events in Lawmatics

put.description:
Update an existing Matter by ID.

PATCH works for this endpoint as well as PUT.

Update Event.value:
{
	"name": "New Appointment Changed",
	"description": "API Appointment",
	"start_date": "06/28/2020",
	"end_date": "06/29/2020",
	"user_ids": [{{user_id}}],
	"all_day": false,
	"eventable_type": "Prospect",
	"eventable_id": {{prospect_id}},
	"event_type_id": {{event_type_id}},
	"location_id": {{location_id}},
	"reminder_delay_length": 10,
	"reminder_type": "minutes",
	"send_invites": true,
	"no_show": true,
    "time_zone": "America/Los_Angeles"
}

get.description: A __paginated__ list of all Events in Lawmatics

post.description:
Create a new **Event**/Appointment

**Optional Fields**: Reminder fields, **Location** fields, time_zone

**eventable_type, eventable_id**: The **Prospect**, **Contact**, or **Client** that the appointment is with.

**user_ids**: The Firm **Users** hosting the appointment.

**reminder_type**: 'minutes', 'hours', 'days', 'weeks', months'

**reminder_delay_length:** Integer value (combined with reminder_type) for how long to wait to send a reminder

**send_invites:** (default true)

**all_day:** (default false)

**time_zone**: a valid [tz identifier string](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones)), (defaults to null)

get.description: A specific File's metadata in Lawmatics

put.description:
Updates an **File** by ID

**documentable_type**: One of \["firm", "client", "matter", "contact"\]

**documentable_id:** The record ID, not needed for Firm documentable_type.

**file**: File to upload

**folder_id:** the Folder ID the file should be located in

**name:** name for the File. Defaults to uploaded file name

**path:** String Array. e.g. \["Root", "Folder 1", "Folder 2"\]. Finds folder with name or creates it if it doesn't exist. Path overrides folder_id if both given.

200.description: PUT Update File Metadata / PUT Move file to file path

get.description:
A **paginated** list of all File metadata in Lawmatics

Can be filtered by `matter_id` , `prospect_id` , `contact_id` , `client_id` and `firm`

as well as all the regular fields as referenced by our Param Guide (most fields returned by`?fields=all`).

post.description:
Uploads a file to a Firm, Matter, Contact or Client

Max allowed file size is 1GB. However, we recommend to avoid files greater than 100MB.

**documentable_type**: One of \["firm", "client", "matter", "contact"\]

**documentable_id:** The record ID, not needed for Firm documentable_type.

**file**: File to upload

**folder_id:** the Folder ID the file should be located in

**name:** name for the File. Defaults to uploaded file name

**path:** String Array. e.g. \["Root", "Folder 1", "Folder 2"\]. Finds folder with name or creates it if it doesn't exist. Path overrides folder_id if both given.

201.description: POST Upload File / POST Upload File to a file path / POST Upload File to a specifc folder

get.description:
*   When testing from **Postman** please click on '**Send and download**' option instead of '**Send**'.
    

*   a 404 can be sent case the file isn't found.

detail.example: File with id invalidId was not found.

example.detail: File with id invalidId was not found.
example.title: Not found

errors.detail: File with id invalidId was not found.
errors.title: Not found

get.description: A specific Folder's metadata in Lawmatics

put.description:
Updates a **Folder** by ID

**documentable_type**: One of \["matter", "contact"\]

**documentable_id:** The record ID

**name**: Folder name. Must be unique within parent folder. Returns 429 if name is already taken. Any slashes "/" in folder name will be replaces with colons ":"

**folder_id**: Folder ID if adding a subfolder

**path:** String Array. e.g. \["Root", "Folder 1", "Folder 2"\]. Finds folders with the name or creates it if it doesn't exist. Moves folder into the Folder with the last name in the path. `path` overrides **`folder_id`** if both given.

name.description: Must be unique within folder.  "/" in folder name will be replaces with ":"

200.description: PUT Update Folder / PUT Update Subfolder / PUT Update Subfolder by folder path

attributes.name: Subfolder is now a root folder

get.description:
A **paginated** list of all Folder metadata in Lawmatics

Can be filtered by `matter_id` , `prospect_id` , `contact_id`

as well as all the regular fields as referenced by our Param Guide (most fields returned by`?fields=all`).

post.description:
Creates a folder for a Matter or Contact

**documentable_type**: One of \["matter", "contact"\]

**documentable_id:** The record ID

**name**: Folder name. Must be unique within parent folder. Returns 429 if name is already taken. Any slashes "/" in folder name will be replaces with colons ":"

**folder_id**: Folder ID if adding a subfolder

**path:** String Array. e.g. \["Root", "Folder 1", "Folder 2"\]. Finds the folder with the name or creates it if it doesn't exist. Path overrides folder_id if both given.

name.description: Must be unique within folder.  "/" in folder name will be replaces with ":"

get.description: A **paginated** list of all **Phone Numbers** in Lawmatics

post.description:
Create a new **Phone Number**

**Required Fields**: informationable, label, info

  
**info:** The Phone Number string.

**label**: The **Phone Number**'s label e.g. Primary.

**informationable_type**: **Prospect**, **Contact**, **Company**, or **Firm** that the **Phone Number** belongs to.

**informationable_id:** Id of Record. **Firm** type doesn't need an ID passed and it will be ignored.

Note - Setting the **Phone Number** through a **Prospect** (Matter) will set the address on the **Prospects**' **Contact**/**Company**.

Attaches tags to a **Matter**, **Contact**, **Company**, or **Task**

**(type)_id:** The ID of the entity to attach tags to. One of `matter_id`, `contact_id`, `company_id,` or `task_id`.

**tags:** List of tags to attach. If a tag does not exist, it will be created.

Detaches tags from a Matter, Contact, Company, or Task

**(type)_id:** The ID of the entity to detach **Tags** from. One of `matter_id`, `contact_id`, `company_id,` or `task_id`.

**tags:** List of **Tags** to detach. If a **Tag** does not exist, it will be ignored.

tags.name: Getting Started With Auth
tags.description:
Lawmatics' REST API uses the standard OAuth2.0 token grant flow. If you are familiar with OAuth2.0, auth should be straightforward. If you are not this webpage explains OAuth2.0 concisely: [https://aaronparecki.com/oauth-2-simplified/](https://)

#### Creating a new OAuth2 Lawmatics Developer App:

To create a new developer app, you must first register a new Lawmatics account and have developer settings granted by a support rep. You can reach out via email, phone, or the chat on our homepage.  
While logged in to your Lawmatics account, go to `https://app.lawmatics.com/settings/developers`.

You can see how it's done here: [https://www.useloom.com/share/bfbfa6642b0b4b97aa3ef87d29817e0b](https://)

To get credentials for programatic access. Click 'New Application' and enter the Name, Description, and Logo that your app users will see when connecting through your app. As well as the Callback URL they will be redirected back to, after they grant your app access to their account.

---

#### Authenticating with your Client App:

In your application, users click the following authorize link. They will auth their Lawmatics account, and then grant or deny your Client App to make changes to their Lawmatics account on their behalf. Then we will redirect the user back to your website along with our grant token as a query param.

**STEP 1: Getting a Grant Code**

Our authorize url: `https://app.lawmatics.com/oauth/authorize`.

This url must pass the following Query Params:

- `client_id`: The app id shown in developer settings.
- `redirect_uri`: The callback url that you set when creating your developer app, shown in developer settings, we will redirect the user to this url along with the grant token.
- `response_type`: This should always be set to 'code'
- `state` (optional): This can be sent by your application to maintain state between the request and the callback.
    

All together, a valid request link will look something like this:

`https://app.lawmatics.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=&redirect_uri=&response_type=code`.

When the user authenticates, and grants access to your app, they will be redirected back to GET

`https://www.callbackurl.com/?code=f2da562a94981e24d610b021aedaae03eb286acab7cd855013f9165aebbeef48`

along with a `code` query param. This `code` is a short lived grant token that needs to be captured by your backend and utilized to receive the `access_token`.

**STEP 2: Getting an Access Token**

In your backend make a POST request to `https://api.lawmatics.com/oauth/token`.

The POST body must contain the following required params:

- `client_id`: The app key from above
- `client_secret`: The app secret from above
- `grant_type`: "authorization_code"
- `code`: The authorization code returned from the redirect above
- `redirect_uri`: The callback URL used in the authorization request above
    

This will create and return a non-expiring `access_token` that you should save associated with your user.

```
   HTTP/1.1 200 OK
   {
     "token_type":"bearer",
     "access_token":"WjR8HLdo847Z8kdfUtewJpCvkRX4JYLCIF2dUUul",
     "created_at": 1539723267
   }

 ```

This token can now be passed as an `Authorization` header to authenticate all of our endpoints on behalf of that tokens user!

E.g. `Authorization= Bearer`

---

#### Limitations

- We currently do not support scopes. Once a user authenticates your app, they are giving you full CRUD access to their account.
- We do not have a deauthorization endpoint, this is coming soon.
- We do not give you a refresh token. Access tokens do not expire so they are not needed.

tags.name: Param Guide
tags.description:
We currently have three possible types of Query Param options that can be included with any request to modify the results.

1. __Field Selection__
2. __Pagination__
3. __Sorting__
4. __Filtering__

There are two types of Queries,

1. Queries that return a Single Object. These only have access to __Field Selection__ Query Params.
2. Queries that return a List of Objects. These have access to all Query Params.

tags.name: Field Selection
Pagination
tags.description:
Pagination meta information is found at the bottom of any List response.

You can change pages by passing `?page=X`, where X is the page number, as a Query Param appended to the endpoint URL.

E.g. to see page 3 you would pass `?page=3`

tags.name: Sorting
tags.description:
By default List responses are sorted by `id` from biggest to smallest. (descending)

Customizing the sort order of the response works with Two Query Params:

1. `sort_order`: Can be `asc` or `desc`.
2. `sort_by`

Available `sort_by` columns are:
`id, created_at, updated_at`
As well as most fields listed by the fields='all' response.

If you use `sort_order` without `sort_by`, `sort_by` defaults to sort by `id`.

tags.name: Filtering
tags.description:
By default List responses will return all records without any filters.

Filtering the request works by appending these Query Params:

1. `filter_by` or `filter_field`: This specifies the field name to filter on.
2. `filter_on` or `filter_value`: This is the value to filter on.
3. `filter_with` or `filter_operator`: (Optional) This is the operator used to filter. (default: '=')
    

The available `filter_by` columns are:

- _Most_ (contact us) standard fields listed in the fields='all' response.
- Currency attributes are by cents.
- Association attributes require `_id` to be appended. E.g `practice_area_id`.
    

Additional Notes:

- If you use `filter_by` without `filter_on`, we will return an error response.
- Valid `filter_operator`s are one of: `['=', '!=', <=','<','>=','>','like','ilike']`
    
- Additional valid`filter_operators` for checking presence:`['null', 'not_null']`
    
    - These do not require a `filter_value`
        
    - Aliases: `['empty', 'present', 'blank']`
        
- You do not need to have the field selected, for it to be filterable.
    
- Currently only one filter is supported at a time.
    

`like` and `ilike` are fuzzy String matching operators (ilike is case insensitive).  
As a convenience `ilike` is the operator used by default when filtering on fields of String type.  
If you are using a fuzzy matcher, you must put "%" on the `filter_value`, where you want the fuzzy matching to occur.

Note - (Keep in mind urls must [encode special characters](https://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_urlencode.asp): so '%' becomes '%25')

tags.name: Filtering Examples
tags.description:
#### Matter Filtering Examples


> **Stage**
```
https://api.lawmatics.com/v1/prospects?filter_by=stage_id&filter_on=123
```

> **Case Title (exact)**
```
https://api.lawmatics.com/v1/prospects?filter_by=case_title&filter_on=Sauls Wild Ride
```

> **Case Title (case sensitive fuzzy matches the end)**
```
https://api.lawmatics.com/v1/prospects?filter_by=case_title&filter_on=Sauls Wi%&filter_operator=like
```

> **Case Title (case insensitive fuzzy matches the start)**
```
https://api.lawmatics.com/v1/prospects?filter_by=case_title&filter_on=%uls Wild Ride
```

> **Case Title (case insensitive fuzzy matches both ends)**
```
https://api.lawmatics.com/v1/prospects?filter_by=case_title&filter_on=%ls Wild Ri%
```

> **Estimated Value Less Than or Equal to 1000 Dollars**
```
https://api.lawmatics.com/v1/prospects?filter_by=estimated_value_cents&filter_on=10000&filter_operator=<=
```

> **First Name**
```
https://api.lawmatics.com/v1/prospects?filter_by=first_name&filter_on=Mat%
```

tags.name: Addresses
tags.description: An **Address** belongs to a **Firm,** a **Contact,** or **Company**.

tags.name: Contacts
tags.description:
A __Contact__ can be thought of as a collection of data about a "Person".

A __Contact__ record is the base for all *Contactables* (__Matters__, __Clients__, and __Companies__).

Since __Contact__ data reflects a person, and is a base record, it is shared via any *Contactable* associated with the __Contact__.

---

For Example:

You begin talks with an existing client into opening a new case. In Lawmatics, you would create a __Matter__ selecting this __Contact__ as the base.

If you update the email address on this __Matter__. It actually modifies the __Matter__'s associated __Contact__. Thus, the updated email address, will be shown when you view the __Contact__ directly. It will also show on any __Client__, __Company__ with it as it's Primary __Contact__, or any other hired __Matter__.

tags.name: Contact Finders
tags.description: The following endpoints are fuzzy find endpoints, returning the first __Contact__ which matches the passed values.

tags.name: Custom Contact Types
tags.description: A **Custom Contact Type** is a user defined type to assign to a contact.

tags.name: Company Finders
tags.description: The following endpoints are fuzzy find endpoints, returning the first __Contact__ which matches the passed values.

tags.name: Custom Forms
tags.description:
NOTE: Field IDs for fields that are not considered "Standard", such as General fields, and Custom fields, are referred to by special long-form uuids that are enumerated on the API details page of the Custom Form in Lawmatics. (E.g. https://app.lawmatics.com/custom-forms/:custom_form_id/api-details).

The api details page link is found on the relevant Custom Form edit page as a button in the bottom action bar.

Field IDs can also be found via the response body of the `GET Custom Form` endpoint.
	
The "custom_form_uuid" needed to GET or POST a custom form, is also found on the API details page. It is NOT the same as the form custom form id you can see in the address bar of your browser on the Lawmatics form builder page.


#### Form Components:
> **Standard Fields** - Common contact related Lawmatics defined fields. Standard fields have human readable field_ids.

> **Custom Fields** - Custom user defined fields. Custom fields have long form "uuid" field_ids.

> **General Fields** - General fields whose values are not considered important enough to save as data on a Client/Contact/PNC. Values saved on General fields are simply saved to the form submission record and can only be viewed on the `http://localhost:8080/custom-forms/:custom_form_id/values` page. General Fields have long form "uuid" field_ids.

> **Instruction Blocks** - Blocks of User defined text these are read only and can not be set.

#### Supported Standard Field IDs:
`"first_name"`
`"middle_name"`
`"last_name"`
`"birthdate"`
`"name_prefix"`
`"name_suffix"`
`"informal_name"`
`"employer"`
`"occupation"`
`"citizenship"`
`"social_security"`
`"driver_license"`
`"gender"`
`"marital_status"`
`"timezone"`
`"hobbies"`
`"bio"`
`"title"`
`"email"`
`"phone"`
`"street"`
`"street2"`
`"city"`
`"state"`
`"zipcode"`
`"country"`

tags.name: Email Addresses
tags.description: A **Email Address** is contact information that belongs to a **Firm**, **Contact**, or **Company.**

tags.name: Events (Appointments)
tags.description: *Events* are also referred to in the app as "Appointments"

tags.name: Event Locations
tags.description: These are Firm related Locations (for events) that can be configured in Firm settings.

tags.name: Event Types
tags.description:
**Event Types** define **Event** defaults, and can trigger automations, for common types of **Events** created in Lawmatics.

Configuring Calendar Availability defaults is not currently supported by the API. Go to Settings -> Event Settings to configure the Event Type in more detail.

tags.name: Matters (Prospects)
tags.description:
A **Matter** is a legal case, and the primary object in Lawmatics. NOTE: You may see **Matters** referenced as "Prospects" or "PNCs". This is for legacy reasons, and we are working to migrate away from these names internally. When creating a new **Matter** it will be in status _PNC_. This stands for Potential New Case or Potential New Client. It means the Matter has not yet closed. The other statuses for a **Matter** are 'Hired', and 'Lost'. You can also create sub statuses for each of these main statuses in the app if you need more granular categories for your **Matters**. A **Matter** wraps a **Contact** object, and if you create a new **Matter**, it will create a **Contact** for that **Matter** to hold its contact information. NOTE: Matters used to be called Prospects, we changed it to make it more clear that the **Matter** is about case information, and a **Contact** is about a person. One **Contact** can have many **Matters**! And a **Contact** with at least one Hired **Matter** is considered a **Client** **Contact**! # Supported Matter Fields We support the following fields in the request body for our Create/Update **Matter** endpoint: | attribute | notes | | --- | --- | | case_title | | | case_number | String (overrides auto-numbering) | | case_blurb | (Case Description) | | contact_id | **Required** unless `match_contact_by` is set | | match_contact_by | **Create Matter Field:** Valid values: 'email', 'phone', 'name' (Will attempt to match contact by passed info) | | actual_value_cents | | | estimated_value_cents | | | lead_cost_cents | | | source_id | | | campaign_id | | | referrer_id | | | sub_status_id | | | custom_fields | Array of "id" and "value" objects:
\[
{ "id": "6433", "value": true },
{ "id": "6434", "value": "Contact String" }
\] | | practice_area_id | | | stage_id | | | owned_by_id | User ID | | created_by_id | User ID | | salesperson_id | User ID | | lead_attorney_id | User ID | | originating_attorney_id | User ID | | assigned_staff_ids | Array of User IDs | | tags | Array of Strings (tag name) | | street | Creates/Updates Address with 'Primary' Label | | street2 | Creates/Updates Address with 'Primary' Label | | city | Creates/Updates Address with 'Primary' Label | | state | Creates/Updates Address with 'Primary' Label | | zipcode | Creates/Updates Address with 'Primary' Label | | country | Creates/Updates Address with 'Primary' Label | | email | Creates/Updates with 'Primary' Label | | phone | Creates/Updates with 'Primary' Label | | first_name | | | last_name | | | middle_name | | | citizenship | | | driver_license | | | name_suffix | | | informal_name | | | bio | | | title | | | birthdate | | | gender | | | timezone | | | occupation | | | employer | | | social_security | | | name_prefix | | | marital_status | | | hobbies | | | birthdate | | | custom_contact_type_id | |

tags.name: Matter Finders
tags.description: The following endpoints are fuzzy find endpoints, returning the first __Matter__ which matches the passed values.

tags.name: Matter Interactions
tags.description: External **Interaction** logs that will be displayed in the activity timeline of a **Matter**.

tags.name: Matter Pipeline Stages
tags.description:
A **Stage** is a single step of a process **Pipeline**, that a **Matter** is in.

Setting a **Stage** on a **Matter** is a way for a Lawmatics Firm to organize **Matters** according to their custom business processes.

*   You can see a high level overview of all your **Matters** and their **Stages** in the **Pipelines** view.
*   You can trigger automations to fire based on which **Stage** a **Matter** is currently in.

tags.name: Matter Relationships
tags.description: *Relationships* are connections between a Matter and a Contact

tags.name: Matter Relationship Types
tags.description: These are configured in Matter Settings.

tags.name: Matter Sub Statuses
tags.description: A **Sub Status** is a user defined sub category of the three main statuses (pnc, hired, lost) that a *Matter* can be in.

tags.name: Phone Numbers
tags.description: A **Phone Number** is contact information that belongs to a **Firm**, **Contact**, or **Company.**
